taxPolicy.notice: As second-hand goods, this purchase may be tax-exempt in your region.
taxPolicy.learnMore: Learn more about our tax policy
taxPolicy.title: Tax Policy for Second-Hand Vintage Goods
taxPolicy.subtitle: Understanding tax treatment for vintage and second-hand items
taxPolicy.disclaimer: This is general information only and does not constitute tax or legal advice. Please consult with qualified tax professionals regarding your specific situation.
taxPolicy.overviewIntro: Tax laws vary significantly by jurisdiction. This policy outlines how we handle tax for second-hand vintage goods sold through our platform.
taxPolicy.overviewExplanation: In most jurisdictions, second-hand goods are exempt from standard sales tax/VAT when sold by individuals or under special margin schemes, as the tax was already paid when the item was originally purchased new.
taxPolicy.currentPolicyHighlight: All sales on this platform are processed with $0.00 tax.
taxPolicy.currentPolicyRationale: This reflects the tax-exempt status of genuine second-hand goods in most jurisdictions:
taxPolicy.rationalePoint1: All items sold are genuine second-hand/vintage goods
taxPolicy.rationalePoint2: Items are personal property being resold
taxPolicy.rationalePoint3: Most jurisdictions exempt such sales from standard sales tax/VAT
taxPolicy.rationalePoint4: Compliant with margin scheme principles where applicable
taxPolicy.customerResponsibilitiesIntro: While we do not collect tax on these transactions, customers may have obligations in their jurisdiction:
taxPolicy.useTaxDescription: Some jurisdictions require buyers to self-report and pay use tax on purchases.
taxPolicy.importDutiesDescription: International buyers may owe customs duties and VAT/GST when goods enter their country.
taxPolicy.recordKeepingDescription: Keep purchase receipts for your tax records and potential future resale.
taxPolicy.professionalAdviceDescription: Consult a tax professional if you're uncertain about your tax obligations.
taxPolicy.regionalInfoIntro: Here's a brief overview of tax treatment by region. For detailed information, see our full documentation.
taxPolicy.usDescription: Most states exempt used goods from sales tax. Tax was already paid on the original purchase.
taxPolicy.euDescription: Second-hand goods qualify for the VAT Margin Scheme, where VAT is only charged on the profit margin.
taxPolicy.ukDescription: VAT Margin Scheme applies to second-hand goods. No VAT on exports with proper documentation.
taxPolicy.canadaDescription: GST/HST generally does not apply when individuals sell used personal property.
taxPolicy.australiaDescription: GST may not apply to second-hand goods under the margin scheme, depending on your business status.
taxPolicy.japanDescription: Special consumption tax rules apply for used goods. Business threshold is ¥10 million in annual sales.
taxPolicy.questionsIntro: Consult with a qualified tax professional if:
taxPolicy.questionItem1: Your annual sales exceed thresholds in your jurisdiction
taxPolicy.questionItem3: You've received a tax audit notice
taxPolicy.questionItem4: Laws have recently changed in your area
taxPolicy.documentationDescription: For complete details including specific tax rules by jurisdiction, compliance requirements, and record-keeping guidelines, please refer to our full tax policy documentation.
